column48: and expect their employees to do the same. When an employee ‘screws up’ (i.e. loses the bank a lot of money)

column48: 'You work in a low-gravity environment on a large space station

column44: You begin with a T-90 Patrol Drone

column48: watching as your Walker Drone pounds street punks into a bloody mess. The only real challenge of the battle is afterwards

column47: 'You are a highly qualified technical engineer with a solid grasp of the latest technology. Your skills are in high demand across the galaxy and there is very little you cannot fix or reprogram. Being able to repair your own ship greatly reduces costs
column48: and makes you a lifesaver in any group you care to join.')

column47: 'The lure of deep space beckons to the bold. Fabulous hidden riches await those with the guts to venture beyond the bubble of human occupied space. As an explorer you are expert in navigation and survival. There is nothing you like better than landing on a pristine alien world and to churn up the earth as you speed around in your eight-wheeled SRV.')

column48: 'The Federation military is constantly planning for the war to end all wars – a direct confrontation with the Imperial navy. The trouble is they don’t want to pay for it
column49: at least not all the time.  Rather than have billions of troops on constant standby
column50: the Federation runs a volunteer military program for patriotic reservists.  Such men and women are wannabe soldiers
column51: either unfit for full service or too bound to civilian life to be willing to devote their entire lives to the cause.  Some reservists are quiet patriots who patiently wait for their nation to call them up.  Others will never cease to remind their friends and neighbours that they are fully-trained soldiers
column52: even going so far as to wear their uniform off duty.')

column47: 'In addition to your basic training you have received advanced training to fly a combat spaceship

column49: either as part of a formal navy or
column50: more likely
column51: as part of a planetary defence force. Your quick reactions make you one of the best space warriors in the galaxy.')

column48: 'Across the galaxy tyranny and dictatorship are in good shape
column49: with petty despots lording it over their frightened and bullied population. You were part of a band of fighters that stood up to this oppression using stealth
column50: resourcefulness or good old fashioned grit. Perhaps you were successful and your planet is now free
column51: or maybe your band was hunted down and you are the last survivor. Either way it is time to move on with your life.')

column47: 'You worked on a small trading ship
column48: selling desperately needed goods to the poorest folk on the frontier. Many of those places are ridden with anarchy or spirit crushing autocracies
column49: and you had to fight to survive when petty criminals or corrupt tax inspectors came to shake you down. Now you own your own ship. With your extensive trading experience it’s time to earn some real money!')

column47: 'The Fuel Rats are a charitable organisation that rescues stranded pilots who accidentally use up all their fuel supplies. Sometimes derided by pilots who claim the Fuel Rats have too much time on their hands
column48: no one forgets the moment a noble Fuel Rat saves them from certain death in the cold depths of space. You are an ex-ratter

column50: it doesn’t pay the bills
column51: so now it’s time to go out and earn some credits!')

column48: manic stare.')

column49: and you had to keep an eye out for customers who wished to game the system.')

City brokers
column49: factory workers? The wild is nurturing and honest
